ad_creative_bodies:
Sign if you agree. Canada needs to catch up. 

Although our country is almost 400 times larger, Rwanda has had a far bigger impact on the fight against dangerous plastic pollution.

Since 2008, the small African country has banned the import, manufacture and distribution of plastic, with few exceptions. 

Rwanda is beating out vastly more wealthy countries like ours in taking climate and environmental action seriously — boldly demonstrating that there’s no reason we can’t do the same. 

If you agree that Canada needs to be a leader on the world stage, join our people-led movement today.

ad_creative_bodies:
Temperatures are rising — and so are Canadians. 

More than ever before, we are demanding stronger climate action. From making corporations pay for pollution to holding governments accountable for missed climate targets, a people-led movement is our best chance to prevent runaway climate change.

Now, we need your voice to secure a safe and green future. Take the pledge and join the movement today.

ad_creative_bodies:
Sign if you agree. For young people, bold climate action is becoming a matter of life and death. 

We know that if we don’t make a drastic shift now, our planet will be unrecognizable and unlivable. 

The climate emergency is no longer up for debate. If you’re a Canadian who cares about the next generation, then you’re probably already part of the massive push to hold governments and corporations accountable for what we do — or don’t — in the next few years. 

Environmental Defence Canada is at the forefront of climate advocacy, and we need your voice. Take the pledge and join the movement.

ad_creative_bodies:
It’s time to build on our ambition. 9 out of 10  Canadians believe the country is doing well on climate change - but we’re the only country in the G7 whose emissions have gone up. 

As heat waves, wildfires, floods and dangerous weather become the norm, people across Canada are ready for bolder action now — and we have already fought and won major milestones towards a safe future. 

Help us through the final stretch on our way to a greener, cleaner, safer Canada. Take the pledge and become a climate advocate today.

ad_creative_bodies:
Sign if you agree. Canada needs to catch up. 

Although our country is almost 400 times larger, Rwanda has had a far bigger impact on the fight against dangerous plastic pollution.

Since 2008, the small African country has banned the import, manufacture and distribution of plastic, with few exceptions. 

Rwanda is beating out vastly more wealthy countries like ours in taking climate and environmental action seriously — boldly demonstrating that there’s no reason we can’t do the same. 

If you agree that Canada needs to be a leader on the world stage, join our people-led movement today.

Temperatures are rising — and so are Canadians. 

More than ever before, we are demanding stronger climate action. From making corporations pay for pollution to holding governments accountable for missed climate targets, a people-led movement is our best chance to prevent runaway climate change.

Now, we need your voice to secure a safe and green future. Take the pledge and join the movement today.

ad_creative_bodies:
Sign if you agree. For young people, bold climate action is becoming a matter of life and death. 

We know that if we don’t make a drastic shift now, our planet will be unrecognizable and unlivable. 

The climate emergency is no longer up for debate. If you’re a Canadian who cares about the next generation, then you’re probably already part of the massive push to hold governments and corporations accountable for what we do — or don’t — in the next few years. 

Environmental Defence Canada is at the forefront of climate advocacy, and we need your voice. Take the pledge and join the movement.

ad_creative_bodies:
Canada needs to catch up. 

Although our country is almost 400 times larger, Rwanda has had a far bigger impact on the fight against dangerous plastic pollution.

Since 2008, the small African country has banned the import, manufacture and distribution of plastic, with few exceptions. 

Rwanda is beating out vastly more wealthy countries like ours in taking climate and environmental action seriously — boldly demonstrating that there’s no reason we can’t do the same. 

If you agree that Canada needs to be a leader on the world stage, join our people-led movement today.

ad_creative_bodies:
Sign if you agree. For young people, bold climate action is becoming a matter of life and death. 

We know that if we don’t make a drastic shift now, our planet will be unrecognizable and unlivable. 

The climate emergency is no longer up for debate. If you’re a Canadian who cares about the next generation, then you’re probably already part of the massive push to hold governments and corporations accountable for what we do — or don’t — in the next few years. 

Environmental Defence Canada is at the forefront of climate advocacy, and we need your voice. Take the pledge and join the movement.

ad_creative_bodies:
Myth: Canada is doing its part as a global leader to help poorer countries cut carbon emissions and minimize the effects of climate change. 

Fact: Over the next five years, Canada will only give 25% of its fair share to support poorer countries. 

In fact, in 2009, wealthier countries like Canada, pledged $100 billion each year by 2020 to poorer countries. This goal was never met, and climate activists argue that no clear plans have been made to do better in the years coming. Canadians expect more, and we can do better. 

Add your name now to become a climate advocate.

ad_creative_bodies:
Myth: Canada is doing its part as a global leader to help poorer countries cut carbon emissions and minimize the effects of climate change. 

Fact: Over the next five years, Canada will only give 25% of its fair share to support poorer countries. 

In fact, in 2009, wealthier countries like Canada, pledged $100 billion each year by 2020 to poorer countries. This goal was never met, and climate activists argue that no clear plans have been made to do better in the years coming. Canadians expect more, and we can do better. 

Add your name now to become a climate advocate.

ad_creative_bodies:
Myth: Canada is doing its part as a global leader to help poorer countries cut carbon emissions and minimize the effects of climate change. 

Fact: Over the next five years, Canada will only give 25% of its fair share to support poorer countries. 

In fact, in 2009, wealthier countries like Canada, pledged $100 billion each year by 2020 to poorer countries. This goal was never met, and climate activists argue that no clear plans have been made to do better in the years coming. Canadians expect more, and we can do better. 

Add your name now to become a climate advocate.

ad_creative_bodies:
The realities of the climate crisis are more present now than ever.  Record temperatures have become unbearable for our homes, our children, forests, and wildlife. 

What can we do about it? 

We are in the midst of a global emergency. Let’s vote for a party who will act like it. We need a government who will lead the path to a more sustainable, more equitable, and healthier planet.  

One Earth. One Vote.

Vote for a party who cares. Vote for Action. Here’s how.

ad_creative_bodies:
Together, we are bigger than the fossil fuel industry. 

Across the country, Canadians are uniting to call out polluters and to champion climate justice initiatives. The vast majority of us know what needs to be done — and how urgently. 

All that stands in our way is a small group of powerful corporations. They’re willing to squeeze the last few drops of profit out of the dying fossil fuel sector no matter the cost to the rest of us. 

But thanks to people like you, Big Oil’s time is ending.  

Clean energy jobs are multiplying, new oil and gas projects are being cancelled, and Indigenous communities are asserting their land rights over some of our last protected forests, waters and ecosystems. 

There has never been a better time to be part of this strong and vibrant movement. 

Take the pledge and become a climate advocate.

Clean energy is already growing faster, employing more Canadians, and producing energy more affordably than fossil fuels. 

That’s why millions of Canadians have become climate advocates, and the momentum has never been bigger than now. 

Take the pledge and join the movement.

ad_creative_bodies:
Tackling climate change isn’t just necessary for our survival — it’s also an opportunity to put millions of people to work, revitalize our economy, and create a more equitable society for all. 

It’s what hundreds of organizations are calling a Just and Green Recovery. Already, clean energy industries are growing faster than the rest of the economy and employing far more Canadians than fossil fuels. 

Now, workers, communities and climate advocates are calling for a transformative shift that takes on unemployment, inequality and climate change all at once. 

Take the pledge and join our community of climate advocates today.

ad_creative_bodies:
Together, we are bigger than the fossil fuel industry. 

Across the country, Canadians are uniting to call out polluters and to champion climate justice initiatives. The vast majority of us know what needs to be done — and how urgently. 

All that stands in our way is a small group of powerful corporations. They’re willing to squeeze the last few drops of profit out of the dying fossil fuel sector no matter the cost to the rest of us. 

But thanks to people like you, Big Oil’s time is ending.  

Clean energy jobs are multiplying, new oil and gas projects are being cancelled, and Indigenous communities are asserting their land rights over some of our last protected forests, waters and ecosystems. 

There has never been a better time to be part of this strong and vibrant movement. 

Take the pledge and become a climate advocate.

ad_creative_bodies:
Tackling climate change isn’t just necessary for our survival — it’s also an opportunity to put millions of people to work, revitalize our economy, and create a more equitable society for all. 

It’s what hundreds of organizations are calling a Just and Green Recovery. Already, clean energy industries are growing faster than the rest of the economy and employing far more Canadians than fossil fuels. 

Now, workers, communities and climate advocates are calling for a transformative shift that takes on unemployment, inequality and climate change all at once. 

Take the pledge and join our community of climate advocates today.

ad_creative_bodies:
Temperatures are rising — and so are Canadians. 

More than ever before, we are demanding stronger climate action. From making corporations pay for pollution to holding governments accountable for missed climate targets, a people-led movement is our best chance to prevent runaway climate change.

Now, we need your voice to secure a safe and green future. Take the pledge and join the movement today.

ad_creative_bodies:
The realities of the climate crisis are more present now than ever.  Record temperatures have become unbearable for our homes, our children, forests, and wildlife. 

What can we do about it? 

We are in the midst of a global emergency. Let’s vote for a party who will act like it. We need a government who will lead the path to a more sustainable, more equitable, and healthier planet.  

One Earth. One Vote.

Vote for a party who cares. Vote for Action. Here’s how.

ad_creative_bodies:
COVID-19 has shown us that positive, unified action can change the world. Now we have the power to do it again. We have the solutions to slow the impact of the climate crisis.

We’re already seeing the devastating effects of climate change on our forests, wildlife, homes, and communities. How much more can we endure before it’s too late?

It’s time to vote like our future depends on it. Because it does.

One Earth. One Vote.

This election, vote for a party who will take action. Here’s how.

ad_creative_bodies:
We’re building a people-led movement to push the Canadian government towards stronger climate action - and it’s working. 

By rallying together and demanding stronger climate policy, people like us have already won some of Canada’s biggest climate victories — like putting a price on carbon pollution, phasing out coal powered electricity plants, and creating new laws that hold governments accountable for missed emission reductions targets. 

But with Canada’s emissions still on the rise, there’s still so much more to be done, and we need your help. Sign our pledge today to become a climate advocate.

Fact: With current expansion plans, Canada will be producing more oil and gas in 2050 than we are now.

ad_creative_bodies:
We’re building a people-led movement to push the Canadian government towards stronger climate action - and it’s working. 

By rallying together and demanding stronger climate policy, people like us have already won some of Canada’s biggest climate victories — like putting a price on carbon pollution, phasing out coal powered electricity plants, and creating new laws that hold governments accountable for missed emission reductions targets. 

But with Canada’s emissions still on the rise, there’s still so much more to be done, and we need your help. Sign our pledge today to become a climate advocate.

ad_creative_bodies:
Temperatures are rising — and so are Canadians. 

More than ever before, we are demanding stronger climate action. From making corporations pay for pollution to holding governments accountable for missed climate targets, a people-led movement is our best chance to prevent runaway climate change.

Now, we need your voice to secure a safe and green future. Take the pledge and join the movement today.

ad_creative_bodies:
For young people, bold climate action is becoming a matter of life and death. 

We know that if we don’t make a drastic shift now, our planet will be unrecognizable and unlivable. 

The climate emergency is no longer up for debate. If you’re a Canadian who cares about the next generation, then you’re probably already part of the massive push to hold governments and corporations accountable for what we do — or don’t — in the next few years. 

Environmental Defence Canada is at the forefront of climate advocacy, and we need your voice. Take the pledge and join the movement.

ad_creative_bodies:
Myth: Canada is a global leader when it comes to lowering emissions. 

Fact: Canada is the only G7 country whose emissions have risen since the Paris Climate Agreement. 

We can do better. Sign our pledge today to become a climate advocate and join our movement.

ad_creative_bodies:
Temperatures are rising — and so are Canadians. 

More than ever before, we are demanding stronger climate action. From making corporations pay for pollution to holding governments accountable for missed climate targets, a people-led movement is our best chance to prevent runaway climate change.

Now, we need your voice to secure a safe and green future. Take the pledge and join the movement today.

ad_creative_bodies:
Myth: Canada is a global leader when it comes to lowering emissions. 

Fact: Canada is the only G7 country whose emissions have risen since the Paris Climate Agreement. 

We can do better. Sign our pledge today to become a climate advocate and join our movement.

ad_creative_bodies:
For young people, bold climate action is becoming a matter of life and death. 

We know that if we don’t make a drastic shift now, our planet will be unrecognizable and unlivable. 

The climate emergency is no longer up for debate. If you’re a Canadian who cares about the next generation, then you’re probably already part of the massive push to hold governments and corporations accountable for what we do — or don’t — in the next few years. 

Environmental Defence Canada is at the forefront of climate advocacy, and we need your voice. Take the pledge and join the movement.

ad_creative_bodies:
The realities of the climate crisis are more present now than ever.  Record temperatures have become unbearable for our homes, our children, forests, and wildlife. 

What can we do about it? 

We are in the midst of a global emergency. Let’s vote for a party who will act like it. We need a government who will lead the path to a more sustainable, more equitable, and healthier planet.  

One Earth. One Vote.

Vote for a party who cares. Vote for Action. Here’s how.

Take this quiz and find out!

ad_creative_bodies:
Myth: Canada is slowly divesting from oil and gas. 

Fact: With current expansion plans, Canada will be producing more oil and gas in 2050 than we are now. 

Canadians deserve better. We can do better. Sign our pledge today to become a climate advocate and join our movement.

ad_creative_link_titles: Demand action today

ad_creative_bodies:
We still have time to stop runaway climate change.

Costa Rica has a National Decarbonisation Plan.

The Gambia is rapidly scaling up its solar energy programs.

Morocco has ambitious renewable energy goals — and a solid plan to achieve them.

The solutions are at hand — all we need now is the political will to make them happen.

That’s where you come in. Please join the movement for a safer future for us all — become a climate advocate today.

The solutions are at hand — all we need now is the political will to make them happen.

That’s where you come in. Please join the movement for a safer future for us all — become a climate advocate today.

Costa Rica has a National Decarbonisation Plan.

The Gambia is rapidly scaling up its solar energy programs.

Morocco has ambitious renewable energy goals — and a solid plan to achieve them.

The solutions are at hand — all we need now is the political will to make them happen.

That’s where you come in. Please join the movement for a safer future for us all — become a climate advocate today.

Temperatures are rising — and so are Canadians. 

Corporations and governments are feeling the burn as people demand bold and urgent action on climate change. 

But we still need your voice to make a real impact. Join our community of climate advocates today.

ad_creative_bodies:
For young people, bold climate action is becoming a matter of life and death. 

We know that if we don’t make a drastic shift now, our planet will be unrecognizable and unlivable. 

The climate emergency is no longer up for debate. If you’re a Canadian who cares about the next generation, then you’re probably already part of the massive push to hold governments and corporations accountable for what we do — or don’t — in the next few years. 

Environmental Defence Canada is at the forefront of climate advocacy, and we need your voice. Take the pledge and join the movement.

ad_creative_bodies:
Myth: Canada is slowly divesting from oil and gas. 

Fact: With current expansion plans, Canada will be producing more oil and gas in 2050 than we are now. 

Canadians deserve better. We can do better. Sign our pledge today to become a climate advocate and join our movement.

ad_creative_bodies:
We seek an experienced Communications Manager to develop and execute communications plans to advance change on environmental issues, aligned with Environmental Defence’s mission. The focus of this position will be on climate change issues. The ideal candidate will have experience with media relations, social media engagement, tracking and evaluating communications activities and strong project management skills. They need to be an excellent communicator, organized, work well under pressure, excel in a collaborative workplace, and have a keen eye for detail.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Strategic Planning and Project Management:
- Develop and execute creative communications plans that include media relations, social media, and digital and traditional marketing.
- Contribute to campaign plans and provide ongoing strategic advice to campaigners.
- Develop and manage the communications portion of campaign budgets and work plans.
- Support development team’s fundraising initiatives and other efforts to reach our organizational goals.

Communications Skills:
- Write and edit communications materials including blogs, website text, press releases, op-eds, newsletters, social media content, reports.
- Manage the development of advertising and promotional materials such as social media ads, brochures, posters.
- Develop media relations strategy (proactive and rapid response), pitch and coordinate media interviews, develop key messages, and train/brief spokespeople.
- Social media strategy development, content creation and community management.
- Track, measure and share communications best practices with other staff.

External Relationships:
- Develop relationships with key reporters and influencers.
- Manage external suppliers in the development and design of promotional materials.
- Work effectively with colleagues in other organizations/coalition partners.

QUALIFICATIONS:
- 5 years experience as a communications professional, ideally in an area advancing social change.
- Knowledge of climate change issues and the Canadian political system.
- College or university degree in communications, journalism, public relations or marketing, or equivalent experience.
- Excellent written, verbal and persuasive communication skills; excels at distilling complex subject matter into accessible information others can act upon; strong design eye.
- Demonstrated success using social media and earned media relations to advance a campaign/program.
- Strong project management, organization, work planning and time-management skills.
- Knowledge of database programs (e.g. Engaging Networks), communications analytics and management tools (e.g. Google Analytics, Sprout Social, Meltwater), design programs and video/photo editing software (e.g. Adobe Suite, Canva).
- Bilingual French and English (written and spoken) an asset.

PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES:
- Commitment to Environmental Defence’s vision and mission.
- Enthusiastic communicator who thrives in a fast-paced atmosphere, can meet tight deadlines and balance competing priorities.
Strong interpersonal skills, including team-building, facilitation and conflict resolution
- A creative thinker who can come up with innovative ways to reach new audiences and/or engage supporters.
- A media savvy professional who enjoys keeping up with the latest news on key issues.
- Creative problem-solver with a strong work ethic and keen attention to detail.
- Flexible, motivated, and results-oriented; willing to work late or weekends when rapid response is required.

This is a full time, permanent position. We offer a benefits package after a 3-month probationary period.
Applications will be accepted until July 11, 2021 at 11:59 pm.

HOW TO APPLY:
1. Describe why we should hire you for this job in social media posts (use no more than a series of three posts). Note: this will not be made public.
2. Include your resume and a cover letter detailing your communications experience and how it relates to this role.
3. Send your application by email to hr@environmentaldefence.ca. Include “Communications Manager” in the subject line. No phone calls please.

Environmental Defence embraces equity and diversity and is committed to a workplace that is enriched by the people, needs and desires of Canada’s diverse community. We thank all candidates in advance for their application, but only those contacted for an interview will receive a reply.

ad_creative_bodies:
In Canada, after Shell re-established their membership with one of the large barriers to climate action, CAPP, it became clear that their climate policies were just #greenwashing.⁠
⁠
And now, a Dutch court agrees 🎉⁠
⁠
Seven climate activist groups like @GreenpeaceNederland and @Friends of the Earth @milieudefensie demanded a much steeper reduction in emissions to force oil companies to lessen their impact on the planet and pave the way for clean, renewable energy sources in the future. ⁠
⁠
🌏Activist groups hope that this verdict not only proves that they and the government will not fall for greenwashing tactics but will also be a clear message to the fossil fuel industry as a whole and to ultimately stop putting profit over the well-being of our planet and people. ⁠
⁠
Shell spokesperson shared that they are disappointed by the court’s ruling and will appeal as they aim to become a net-zero emissions company by 2050, “in step with society”. 
⁠
⭐The problem is: societal progression is limited by oil and gas lobbyists who keep holding climate policy and innovation back. ⁠

ad_creative_bodies:
Wouldn’t it be a relief if we knew how to prevent catastrophic climate change? The good news is that we do. 

👉 In order to protect Canada’s environment and prevent catastrophic climate change, we need to push back against the oil and gas lobby #CAPP.

⚠️ While the COVID-19 pandemic has been at the forefront of many Canadians’ lives, oil lobby groups exploited this crisis to worsen another one. They held secret meetings with the federal government to destroy dozens of environmental regulations, laws and policies. CAPP’s lobby group has spent years preventing and delaying any action that brings us closer to climate justice. 
 
“CAPP is rich, well connected, and powerful. But not impervious.”- Keith Brooks, Programs Director at Environmental Defence. Read more: https://bit.ly/3fan9MQ
#climateaction #cdnpoli #oilandgas #climatechange
